project.teaser: NGI Enrichers aims to be the European gateway for Internet innovators to both the US and Canada. An agile and flexible fellowship programme will provide financial support to Internet innovators from European and Horizon Europe associated countries to travel to the US or to...
project.objective: NGI Enrichers aims to be the European gateway for Internet innovators to both the US and Canada. An agile and flexible fellowship programme will provide financial support to Internet innovators from European and Horizon Europe associated countries to travel to the US or to Canada and collaborate with their counterparts on NGI (Next generation Internet)-related topics, such as on trust and data sovereignty, internet architecture renovation and decentralised technologies and solutions. Three open calls will be organised and 70 to 90 EU Internet researchers and innovators will be selected for 3 to 6 months fellowships (travel and monthly allowance), and be hosted by world class US and Canadian universities, research centers, or cutting-edge Internet private sector organisations to jointly develop innovative solutions and services in line with EU values and policy priorities. A community platform will support knowledge sharing and help establish long-term collaborations on NGI technologies, services, and standards. Fellows will participate in hybrid bootcamps, receive on-demand business, technical and collaboration support services and mentorship in order to increase the impact of their collaborations, and participate in a pitch and award ceremony. A pilot action with Canada will also be set up to provide additional or reciprocal fellowships to expand or reinforce initiated NGI collaborations. NGI Enrichers therefore offers a unique and 360° approach offering optimal preparations, ideal onsite conditions and long-term effects with sustainable collaboration partnerships, and will specifically allow to (1) enhance EU-US and EU-Canada cooperation in the development of NGI technologies, services and standards, (2) reinforce and expand NGI transatlantic ecosystem of top researchers, high-tech startups / SMEs and Internet-related communities collaborating on the evolution of the Internet according to a human-centric approach (3) help sharing the EU vision and values with US and Canadian counterparts and thus (4) contribute to the EU internet policy objectives.
project.title: NGI International Collaboration – Transatlantic Fellowship Programme
project.keywords: Next Generation Internet, Innovators, Decentralised technologies and solutions, Data sovereignty, Human-centric approach, AI, 5G, 6G, Internet of Things, Could and edge computing, Xtended reality

article.title: Connecting European and North American internet innovators

result.title: Mentoring Programme - Extract from CMP (initial version)
result.description: Linked with task 2.230+ mentors (least EG, support all) will generate 90+ individual Mentoring sessions that will be reported in the GMP by the NGI Mentors.Data at the end of the first 12 months will be presented in this deliverable, including the summary of the mentorship programme, selected mentors, possible directions for mentorship, etc.

result.title: Package of Transatlantic Fellowship Programme material
result.description: Linked with task 1.1Application requirements, procedures and modalities. The documentation will include all information for applicants, such as requirements and formats of documentation to be submitted, proposal structure / template; characteristics of CVs, submission instructions, either in the online platform or in other forms

result.title: First report on outreach and partnership activities
result.description: Based on the activities in Task 3.3 two reports on Outreach and Partnership activities in the US will be developed (M18 & M35).SPI is leading this deliverable and is contributor covering the activities in the US. APRE is contributor covering the activities in Canada; providing input to SPI to include in this deliverable.

result.title: Report on the second round of open call and lessons learnt
result.description: Linked with task 1.2The second round of calls will be launched at M13 for paired teams and M15 for challenges and open ideasThis report will be focus on the second round of open calls and lessons learnt

result.title: Technical Assistance for US & CA expeditions, Impact and Lessons Learnt (initial version)
result.description: Linked with task 2.1Total 90+ individual Technical Assistance sessions will be reported in the GMP by SPI for the US and APRE for CA.This report will sum-up Impact and Lessons Learnt as initial versionSPI is leading this deliverable and is contributor covering the activities in the US. APRE is contributor covering the activities in Canada; providing input to SPI to include in this deliverable.EUREL will provide the analysis of the feedback from NGI Enrichers fellows.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - NGI Enrichers (NGI International Collaboration – Transatlantic Fellowship Programme)
result.teaser: NGI Enrichers aims to be the EU gateway for NGI innovators to both the US and Canada. By implementing an agile and flexible programming and management of a Transatlantic Fellowship programme, the NGI Enrichers’ consortium reinforces established collaboration ties between...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Report on the first round of open calls and lessons learnt
result.description: Linked with task 1.2The first round of open calls will be launched at M3 with the open call for paired team and followed by the second open call for ‘challenges and open ideas’ at M5.This report will be focus on the first round of open calls and lessons learnt

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
